title: GM to discontinue the Chevy Bolt EV at the end of the year
content:
General Motors Co. said it's going to kill off both of its venerable Bolt electric vehicles (EVs) at the end of this year.

The automaker (NYSE: GM) said it will stop making both the Bolt and the longer Bolt EUV after a seven-year production run. The company said that although it's still selling well, the EV uses outdated battery technology.

The company said it expects to sell 70,000 Bolts this year before the vehicles are discontinued, calling them "the best-selling mainstream EVs in the second half of 2022," in GM's Q4 2022 letter to shareholders.

title: Spanish stocks clock worst day in a month as Santander leads bank slide
content:
Spanish stocks clocked their worst session in a month on Tuesday as heavyweight Santander led a slide among banks amid a disappointing round of earnings for the sector, while an encouraging outlook from Novartis kept healthcare shares afloat.
Spain's lender-heavy IBEX index fell 1.2%, its worst one-day percentage fall since March 24, while the STOXX 600 index dropped 0.4%. Santander slid 6.0% after weaker trade in Brazil and the U.S. overshadowed a rise in first-quarter net profit on a strong performance in Europe.

title: Retailers must up their game as inflation takes food prices nearly 9% higher than this time last year
content:
Food prices are now 8.9% higher than they were last January.


AFP via Getty Images




Just when it looked like we may have reached a turning point in the fight against inflation, newly released figures show its impacts are still hitting retailers right where it hurts.
Data from the Office of National Statistics (ONS) revealed a 0.9 per cent drop in shop sales through March, following consecutive rises in January and February.
The news comes after UK inflation slowed slightly last month but held stubbornly above 10 per cent.

title: Workouts and Remediation of Student Housing Project Bonds
content: For more than three decades, universities and colleges have increasingly relied on off-balance sheet financing of student housing. Such financing structures allow universities to compete with other colleges in providing attractive new student housing, while not straining the institution's credit. Off-balance sheet student housing projects can be financed by third-party student housing management companies, equity investment by third-party developers, taxable project-based bonds, and tax-exempt project-based bonds.

content:
Detroit, Michigan, April 25, 2023 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) — Artificial Intelligence Technology Solutions, Inc., (the 'Company') (OTCPK:AITX), a global leader in AI-driven security and productivity solutions along with its wholly owned subsidiary, Robotic Assistance Devices, Inc. title: Higher Prices, Strong Demand Fuel Coca-Cola Earnings Beat
content:
Coca-Cola (NYSE: KO) reported better-than-expected Q1 2023 earnings and revenue, driven by growing demand for its beverages and higher prices.

The soft drink giant reported adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of 68 cents in the first quarter, beating the consensus estimates of 64 cents per share, according to Refinitiv. Net income attributable to shareholders stood at $3.11 billion, or 72c per share, compared to $2.78 billion, or 64c per share, the company reported in the same quarter last year.

Adjusted revenue came in at $10.

title: Japan ETFs Are Attractive International Ideas
content:
The MSCI Japan Index is higher by 8.34% year-to-date in what could be a sign that global investors are finally nibbling at Japanese equities.


They have good reason to do just that. Broadly speaking, stocks in the world's third-largest economy are attractively valued, sport compelling volatility traits and central bank goings-on aren't yet material in the country. That is to say, the Bank of Japan isn't likely to hike interest rates anytime soon.


With that in mind, although the dollar is poised to weaken, currency hedging remains an attractive way for investors to approach Japanese stocks.

title: Range Resources (RRC) Q1 Earnings Beat on Higher Production
content:
Range Resources Corporation RRC reported first-quarter 2023 adjusted earnings of 96 cents per share, beating the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 73 cents. However, the bottom line declined from the prior-year quarter's earnings of $1.18 per share.
Total quarterly revenues of $853 million surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $823 million. The top line also declined from the prior-year quarter's $987 million.
Better-than-expected quarterly results were driven by higher natural gas-equivalent production volumes.

title: MSG Split Offers Plays on Vegas, Knicks Arena. What to Do With the Stocks.
content:
Las Vegas is one of the prime travel destinations in the country and Sphere Entertainment, the owner of a nearly finished, cutting-edge concert venue in the city, offers an inexpensive way to bet on the city's growth.

Don't worry if you haven't heard of Sphere Entertainment (Ticker SPHR), one of two companies that emerged from the somewhat confusing breakup of Madison Square Garden Entertainment that took effect on Friday. The split was designed to simplify the company and create separate corporate plays on the Sphere and the Madison Square Garden arena, home to the New York Knicks and New York Rangers.
